refnamediv.refpurpose: General function for querying information about FEM objects.

listitem.para: n = FEM:GET('nbdof'[, int cv]) Return the number of dof for the Fem. Some specific Fem (for example 'interpolated_fem') may require a convex number cv to give their result. In most of the case, you can omit this convex number.
d = FEM:GET('dim') Return the dimension (dimension of the reference convex) of the Fem.
td = FEM:GET('target_dim') Return the dimension of the target space. The target space dimension is usually 1, except for vector Fem (none of them has been implemented in getfem++ for now).

P = FEM:GET('pts'[, int cv]) Get the location of the dof on the reference element. Some specific Fem may require a convex number cv to give their result (for example 'interpolated_fem'). In most of the case, you can omit this convex number.
b = FEM:GET('is_equivalent') Return 0 if the Fem is not equivalent. Equivalent Fem are evaluated on the reference convex. This is the case of most classical Fem's.
b = FEM:GET('is_lagrange') Return 0 if the Fem is not of Lagrange type.
b = FEM:GET('is_polynomial') Return 0 if the basis functions are not polynomials.
d = FEM:GET('estimated_degree') Return an estimation of the polynomial degree of the Fem. This is an estimation for fem which are not polynomials.
E = FEM:GET('base_value',mat p) Evaluate all basis functions of the FEM at point p. p is supposed to be in the reference convex!
EH = FEM:GET('hess_base_value',mat p) Evaluate the Hessian of all base functions of the Fem at point p. p is supposed to be in the reference convex!.
FEM:GET('poly_str') Return the polynomial expressions of its basis functions in the reference convex. The result is expressed as a list of strings. Of course this will fail on non-polynomial Fem's.
str = FEM:GET('char') Ouput a (unique) string representation of the Fem. This can be used to perform comparisons between two different Fem objects.
